issue.title: [C++][FlightRPC] Benchmark in-process Flight performance
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-15756](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15756). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
It can be convenient to use Flight to abstract over communication within a process and between two processes. We should add this case to the benchmark to start. UCX has an in-process loopback transport (`UCX_TLS=self`), and ARROW-15282 will enable implementing a specialized transport if more performance is desired (e.g. possibly based on the C Data Interface).

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15756?focusedCommentId=17517500) by David Li (lidavidm):*
I couldn't get this to work. I wonder if UCX_TLS=self only works if both sides share a worker as well (which would be a little unfortunate).

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15756?focusedCommentId=17565807) by @toddfarmer:*

Please feel free to re-take assignment of the issue if it is being actively worked, or if you plan to start that work soon.
